gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat

Class StandoffPreAnnotator

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.brat.StandoffPreAnnotator

  • public class StandoffPreAnnotator
extends java.lang.Object
    A class with static methods to automatically annotate a text file with a pre-defined list of annotation strings.
    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

      Pre-annotates a text file with the annotations provided in preAnns.
      static void preAnnotateDirectory(java.lang.String in, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> preAnns, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> preAnnCounts, java.lang.String out)
      Pre-annotates all text files in a directory.
      static void readPreAnnFile(java.lang.String file, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> anns, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> cnts)
      Reads a pre-annotation file, which is expected to contain tab-delimited string/semantic type/count triples on each line.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • readPreAnnFile

        public static void readPreAnnFile(java.lang.String file,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> anns,
                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> cnts)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a pre-annotation file, which is expected to contain tab-delimited string/semantic type/count triples on each line. Lines beginning with # are ignored.
        Parameters:
        file - the pre-annotation file to read
        anns - a Map of pre-annotation/type pairs, created by the method
        cnts - a Map of pre-annotation/count pairs, created by the method
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem with reading file

      • preAnnotate

        public static void preAnnotate(java.lang.String id,
                               java.lang.String textFile,
                               java.lang.String annFile,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> preAnns,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> preAnnCounts,
                               java.lang.String outAnnFile)
        Pre-annotates a text file with the annotations provided in preAnns.

        If multiple pre-annotations are available for a given string (i.e., ambiguity), the most frequent pre-annotation will be used. This method currently only pre-annotates with term annotations.

        Parameters:
        id - the file identifier
        textFile - the text file to read
        annFile - the existing annotation file corresponding to the text file
        preAnns - a Map of pre-annotations, generated by #readPreAnnFile(String, Map, Map)
        preAnnCounts - a Map of pre-annotation counts, generated by #readPreAnnFile(String, Map, Map)
        outAnnFile - the file to write all annotations to

      • preAnnotateDirectory

        public static void preAnnotateDirectory(java.lang.String in,
                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> preAnns,
                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> preAnnCounts,
                                        java.lang.String out)
        Pre-annotates all text files in a directory. It expects the text files have the extension 'txt'.
        Parameters:
        in - the input directory
        preAnns - the pre-annotation map
        preAnnCounts - the pre-annotation counts
        out - the output directory

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
